title: How to Make Chocolate Pizzelles

text: Heat up the pizzelle maker for a few minutes and in the mean time you try mixing the ingredients.  Take out a small bowl and mix up the orange zest into the sugar with your fingers (optional).  Beat the sugar and eggs together until the mixture is light in the bowl with hand mixer (or the bowl of the stand mixer).  Add the water (preferably cold), fresh butter, and vanilla. Whisk together the cocoa powder and flour, making sure there are no lumps, then add to the wet mixture. Mix on low until the batter is smooth and the chocolate color is even throughout. Pour one tablespoon of the batter for each cookie onto the heated pizzelle maker(which should be heated by now) and close the top. Cook according to the manufacturer’s directions, usually 30-60 seconds. Lift with a fork gently or silicone spatula and transfer to a wire rack. Store in a tin, not airtight, away from other cookies. They need some exposure to air to stay crispy. They can be served flat or rolled into a cone or tube shape, and both the rolled shapes just beg to be filled with some kind of cream or mascarpone filling. Enjoy the tasty bites.
